intro: Psychotria brachyantha, commonly known as the "soul of the forest," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark red berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. Psychotria brachyantha is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
